UNIVERSITY BROADCASTING SERVICES
January 8, 1957
Dr. Sam Becker, Director
Television Center
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
It was mighty good to learn this morning that you are the new Chairman of
the NAEB Research Committee! I suggested to Harry and Burton that the
work of the coranittee had reached the stage where it should be chaired by
a man with the credentials you possessed* I only hope that I may cooperate
as well with you as you did with me.
There are three bound files of material to be mailed to you. Since there
are a few personal letters to be pulled, I will not ship them out until
tomorrow.
There are several things you may wish to do:
1) All of the publications from grants-in-aid have not been
received; these should be obtained and checked out.
2) Over sixty personal letters have been sent out to thank
various people at the seminar. However, Gerhart D. Wiebe,
of Elmo Roper and Associates, still needs to be thanked for
his participation. A formal note needs to go to Dick Hull
and to Keith Tyler for their fine cooperation. (The President
and Vice-President at Ohio have already been thanked.
The fourth letter and perhaps it should have been among the
first, but the holidays shut everything down here, should go
to Mr. Herbert E. Evans, Vice President and General Manager,
People*s Broadcasting Corp., Columbus, thanking him for the
fine steak dinner he provided.
3) A formal request went into the Board for funds to pay for the
editing of the seminar material. Another request has been
filed requesting that funds be provided for the position of a
Director of Research. At this time you may wish to make an
additional request for funds needed to pay committee trans¬
portation costs. One thing hinges on the other, but it seems
to me that it should be in the budget requests at once.
ii) You may also wish to file a formal request for grants-in-aid
help. I believe that $5,000.00 has been suggested.
